text: Raymond "Ray" Thomas (29 December 1941 â€“ 4 January 2018) was an English musician. He was best known as a flautist, singer and composer in the rock band, The Moody Blues. ==Works== Some of his compositions are; "Another Morning" and "Twilight Time" (from Days of Future Passed), "Dr. Livingstone, I Presume" and "Legend of a Mind" (from In Search of the Lost Chord), "Dear Diary" and "Lazy Day" (from On the Threshold of a Dream), "Eternity Road", and "Floating" (from To Our Children's Children's Children), "And the Tide Rushes In" (from A Question of Balance), "Our Guessing Game" and "Nice to Be Here" (from Every Good Boy Deserves Favour), "For My Lady" (from Seventh Sojourn), and the medley "Painted Smile/Reflective Smile/Veteran Cosmic Rocker" (from Long Distance Voyager). ==Death== Thomas died on 4 January 2018 of prostate cancer in Surrey at the age of 76. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Ray Thomas website Category:1941 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:English singer-songwriters Category:English rock musicians Category:English rock singers Category:British keyboardists Category:Musicians from Worcestershire Category:Progressive rock singers
